soffico.customerapi.landscape

Class FileAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • soffico.customerapi.landscape.FileAdapter

  • public class FileAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as an adapter for accessing file systems by use of the orchestra internal file protocols

    • Method Detail

      • deleteFileForUser

        public static void deleteFileForUser(java.lang.String scenarioIdentifier,
                                     java.lang.String environmentEntryName,
                                     java.lang.String credentialName,
                                     java.lang.String fileName)
                              throws OrchestraCustomerException
        Delete a file identified by a filename and a file environment entry. This function can be used for any supported file system. Therefore an authentication information is required.
        Parameters:
        scenarioIdentifier - Unique scenario identifier
        environmentEntryName - Name of the file environment entry
        credentialName - Name of the credential or null if no authentication is needed.
        fileName - File that has to be deleted
        Throws:
        OrchestraCustomerException

      • deleteLocalFile

        public static void deleteLocalFile(java.lang.String scenarioIdentifier,
                                   java.lang.String environmentEntryName,
                                   java.lang.String fileName)
                            throws OrchestraCustomerException
        Delete a file identified by a filename and a file environment entry. The underlying file system type has to be local. No security information is required.
        Parameters:
        scenarioIdentifier - Unique scenario identifier
        environmentEntryName - Name of the file environment entry
        fileName - File that has to be deleted
        Throws:
        OrchestraCustomerException

      • getLocalPath

        public static java.lang.String getLocalPath(java.lang.String scenarioIdentifier,
                                            java.lang.String environmentEntryName)
                                     throws OrchestraCustomerException
        Get the path to the directory or file denoted by the given file environment entry. The underlying file system type has to be local. No security information is required. (Available since Orchestra 4.5.4.0)
        Parameters:
        scenarioIdentifier - Unique scenario identifier
        environmentEntryName - Name of the file environment entry
        Returns:
        absolute file path
        Throws:
        OrchestraCustomerException

      • existsFileForUser

        public static boolean existsFileForUser(java.lang.String scenarioIdentifier,
                                        java.lang.String environmentEntryName,
                                        java.lang.String credentialName,
                                        java.lang.String fileName)
                                 throws OrchestraCustomerException
        Check if a file identified by a filename and a file environment entry exists. This function can be used for any of the supported file systems. Therefore an authentication information may be necessary.
        Parameters:
        scenarioIdentifier - Unique scenario identifier
        environmentEntryName - Name of the file environment entry
        credentialName - Name of the credential or null if no authentication is needed.
        fileName - File to be checked
        Throws:
        OrchestraCustomerException

      • getLastModified

        public static long getLastModified(java.lang.String scenarioIdentifier,
                                   java.lang.String environmentEntryName,
                                   java.lang.String credentialName,
                                   java.lang.String fileName)
                            throws OrchestraCustomerException
        Returns the time that this file was last modified. Measured in milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.
        Parameters:
        scenarioIdentifier - Unique scenario identifier
        environmentEntryName - Name of the file environment entry
        credentialName - Name of the credential or null if no authentication is needed.
        fileName - File to be checked
        Returns:
        the modification of the file in milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT
        Throws:
        OrchestraCustomerException

      • getSize

        public static long getSize(java.lang.String scenarioIdentifier,
                           java.lang.String environmentEntryName,
                           java.lang.String credentialName,
                           java.lang.String fileName)
                    throws OrchestraCustomerException
        Returns the size of a file.
        Parameters:
        scenarioIdentifier - Unique scenario identifier
        environmentEntryName - Name of the file environment entry
        credentialName - Name of the credential or null if no authentication is needed.
        fileName - File to be checked
        Returns:
        the file size in bytes
        Throws:
        OrchestraCustomerException

      • listDirectoryForUser

        public static java.lang.String[] listDirectoryForUser(java.lang.String scenarioIdentifier,
                                                      java.lang.String environmentEntryName,
                                                      java.lang.String credentialName,
                                                      java.lang.String dirName)
                                               throws OrchestraCustomerException
        Return an array of file names contained in a directory. The directory is identified by the name of an environment entry and optionally by the name of a sub directory. This function can be used for any of the supported file systems. Therefore an authentication information may be necessary.
        Parameters:
        scenarioIdentifier - Unique scenario identifier
        environmentEntryName - Name of the file environment entry representing a directory.
        credentialName - Name of the credential or null if no authentication is needed.
        dirName - name of a sub directory which is to be listed or null
        Returns:
        array of file names contained in the directory
        Throws:
        OrchestraCustomerException

      • renameFileForUser

        public static void renameFileForUser(java.lang.String scenarioIdentifier,
                                     java.lang.String environmentEntryName,
                                     java.lang.String credentialName,
                                     java.lang.String fileName,
                                     java.lang.String newFileName)
                              throws OrchestraCustomerException
        Rename a file identified by a filename and a file environment entry. This function can be used for any supported file system. Therefore an authentication information is required.
        Parameters:
        scenarioIdentifier - Unique scenario identifier
        environmentEntryName - Name of the file environment entry
        credentialName - Name of the credential or null if no authentication is needed.
        fileName - File that has to be renamed
        newFileName - new name of the file
        Throws:
        OrchestraCustomerException

      • renameLocalFile

        public static void renameLocalFile(java.lang.String scenarioIdentifier,
                                   java.lang.String environmentEntryName,
                                   java.lang.String fileName,
                                   java.lang.String newFileName)
                            throws OrchestraCustomerException
        Rename a file identified by a filename and a file environment entry. The underlying file system type has to be local. No security information is required.
        Parameters:
        scenarioIdentifier - Unique scenario identifier
        environmentEntryName - Name of the file environment entry
        fileName - File that has to be renamed
        newFileName - new name of the file
        Throws:
        OrchestraCustomerException

      • makeUniqueFilenameLocal

        public static java.lang.String makeUniqueFilenameLocal(java.lang.String scenarioIdentifier,
                                                       java.lang.String environmentEntryName,
                                                       java.lang.String fileNamePrefix,
                                                       java.lang.String fileNameSuffix,
                                                       java.lang.String decimalFormatPattern)
                                                throws OrchestraCustomerException
        The method tries to create a unique filename within the given directory. The filename is constructed with the following pattern: fileNamePrefix + <consecutive counter> + fileNameSuffix. The counter starts by "0". If a file with the counter value exists, it is increased and the next filename is tested. This is repeatedly done until a non existing filename can be found. If the counter increases 10000 names an exception is throws
        Parameters:
        scenarioIdentifier - Unique scenario identifier
        environmentEntryName - Name of the file environment entry
        fileNamePrefix - Filename prefix
        fileNameSuffix - Filename suffix
        decimalFormatPattern - Text-Pattern for the counter value. (For Details see java.txt.DecimalFormat). In case of null "00000" is used.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        OrchestraCustomerException

      • makeUniqueFilenameForUser

        public static java.lang.String makeUniqueFilenameForUser(java.lang.String scenarioIdentifier,
                                                         java.lang.String environmentEntryName,
                                                         java.lang.String credentialName,
                                                         java.lang.String fileNamePrefix,
                                                         java.lang.String fileNameSuffix,
                                                         java.lang.String decimalFormatPattern)
                                                  throws OrchestraCustomerException
        The method looks into the given directory and tries to infer a unique filename. The filename is constructed with the following pattern: fileNamePrefix + <consecutive counter> + fileNameSuffix. The counter starts by "0". If a file with the counter value exists, it is increased and the next filename is tested. This is repeatedly done until a non existing filename can be found. If the counter increases 10000 names an exception is throws
        Parameters:
        scenarioIdentifier - Unique scenario identifier
        environmentEntryName - Name of the file environment entry
        credentialName - Name of the credential or null if no authentication is needed.
        fileNamePrefix - Filename prefix
        fileNameSuffix - Filename suffix
        decimalFormatPattern - Text-Pattern for the counter value. (For Details see java.txt.DecimalFormat). In case of null "00000" is used.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        OrchestraCustomerException
